info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 6:49AM CDT until May 2 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma...Texas...
Red River near Gainesville affecting Love and Cooke Counties.
...The Flood Advisory is replaced by a River Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...Texas...
Red River near Burkburnett affecting Cotton, Clay, Tillman, Jefferson and Wichita Counties.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Red River near Gainesville.
* WHEN...Until early Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Crop and range lands... pecan groves... oil wells... and rural roads are flooded or isolated. Low-lying fields... upstream in western Love County in Oklahoma... and Cooke County in Texas... experience overflows several hours before the crest reaches the Interstate Highway I-35 crossing north of Gainesville. Sandpit operations area affected. Livestock and other property should be removed to places which are higher than nearby river banks to avoid being stranded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 24.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The Red River is expected to rise to a crest of 24.8 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING
